revision.text:
{{Use Australian English|date=January 2013}} {{Use dmy dates|date=March 2016}} {{Infobox person |name = Bindi Irwin |image = Bindi Irwin in June 2013.jpg |caption = Irwin in June 2013 |birth_name = Bindi Sue Irwin |birth_date = {{Birth date and age|df=yes|1998|7|24|}} |birth_place = [[Buderim]], [[Queensland]], Australia |occupation = [[Actress]], [[Presenter|television presenter]] |years_active = 2000–present |spouse = |parents = [[Steve Irwin]]
[[Terri Irwin]] |relatives = [[Bob Irwin|Robert "Bob" Irwin]] (Grandfather) |awards = [[Logie Award|Silver Logie]]
[[Daytime Emmy Award|Daytime Emmy]] }} '''Bindi Sue Irwin''' (born 24 July 1998){{cite web | url = http://www.crocodilehunter.com.au/crocodile_hunter/about_steve_terri/family_biography.html |publisher=CrocodileHunter.com | title= The Irwin Family| accessdate=25 March 2001| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20150304014611/http://www.crocodilehunter.com.au/crocodile_hunter/about_steve_terri/family_biography.html | archivedate=4 March 2015| deadurl=no}} is an Australian actress, television personality and conservationist. She is the daughter of [[Steve Irwin]] (star of ''[[The Crocodile Hunter]]'') and [[Terri Irwin]]. She has been involved in acting, singing, songwriting, game show hosting, and has created an instructional fitness DVD. She is also known for winning [[Dancing with the Stars (U.S. season 21)|season 21]] of ''[[Dancing with the Stars (U.S. TV series)|Dancing with the Stars]]'' (U.S.). Her first name comes from the name of her father's favourite female crocodile at the [[Australia Zoo]], and her middle name, Sue, is from the family's dog Sui. According to her father, ''Bindi'' is an [[Aboriginal Australians|Australian Aboriginal]] word that means "young girl".{{cite web | url=http://www.abc.net.au/children/bindi/interview.htm | title=Bindi: The Jungle Girl | accessdate=1 March 2011 | publisher=ABC.net.au|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140110002740/http://www.abc.net.au/children/bindi/interview.htm|archivedate=10 January 2014|deadurl=yes}} ==Early life== Bindi Irwin was born in [[Buderim, Queensland]]. She began appearing on television shows as early as age two.{{cite news|author = Green, Glenis|url = http://www.news.com.au/couriermail/story/0,,20377536-952,00.html|title = Mantle passes to Bindi|work= [[The Courier-Mail]]|date = 9 September 2006}} She appeared regularly in her father's television shows, including ''[[The Crocodile Hunter Diaries]]'', and also appeared in the 2002 film ''[[The Wiggles]]: [[Wiggly Safari]]'' in a credited cast role. She is of [[English people|English]] and [[Irish people|Irish]] ancestry, with abundance of Irish ancestry on her father's side.{{cite web|url=http://ethnicelebs.com/bindi-irwin|title=Bindi Irwin|publisher=}} Irwin was homeschooled until 2014, when she enrolled at [[TAFE Queensland East Coast]]. She has completed a Certificate III in Business, and is currently studying for a Certificate III in Tourism.{{cite news|last1=Crane|first1=Kris|title=Bindi Irwin looking to take over Australia Zoo and continue Steve Irwin’s legacy|url=http://www.couriermail.com.au/news/queensland/bindi-irwin-looking-to-take-over-australia-zoo-and-continue-steve-irwins-legacy/news-story/2dad5f4b27b39af09338f2f8a001e234|accessdate=23 May 2016|work=The Courier Mail|publisher=News Corp|date=23 January 2016}} ==Career== Irwin was the presenter of a 26-part wildlife documentary kids show called ''[[Bindi the Jungle Girl]]'', a production of the [[Discovery Kids]] television network.{{cite web |url =http://living.scotsman.com/index.cfm?id=1307902006|title = I have no fear of losing my life.|author = Cowning, Emma|work= The Scotsman|date = 5 September 2006}}{{cite news|work=[[Sydney Morning Herald]]|url = http://www.smh.com.au/news/national/bindi-to-fill-her-dads-big-shoes/2006/09/09/1157222376404.html|title = Bindi to fill her dad's big shoes|date = 10 September 2006}}{{cite news|author=Clark, Laine |url=http://www.news.com.au/heraldsun/story/0,,20351375-5005961,00.html |title=Daughter destined to follow in Irwin's footsteps |date=4 September 2006 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071211202334/http://www.news.com.au/heraldsun/story/0,,20351375-5005961,00.html |archivedate=11 December 2007 }} Her father was filmed in many of the early shows before his death in September 2006, when production was temporarily put on hold.{{cite web|url = http://www.alertnet.org/thenews/newsdesk/SYD203498.htm|title = Bindi Irwin Nature Series on Hold for a Year|date = 20 October 2006|publisher = Reuters}} The series premiered in June 2007 on Discovery Kids. Bindi's father, Steve, was killed by a [[stingray]] barb on 4 September 2006. He was setting up to shoot ocean reef footage for a show that would include segments with himself, because weather prevented him from filming footage for a different show. {{cite web |url = http://www.pattayadailynews.com/shownews.php?IDNEWS=0000001387 |title = Steve Irwin's paid tribute from his family and friends |work= Pattaya Daily News |date = 23 September 2006 |author = AJR}} {{cite web |author = Oliveira, Maira |url = http://www.allheadlinenews.com/articles/7004870142 |title = Bindi Irwin To Continue Father's Extraordinary Wildlife Efforts, |publisher = AHN Media Corporation |date = 15 September 2006}} Irwin and her mother announced that she would continue her late father's conservation and television work. {{cite news |url = http://www.dailymail.co.uk/pages/live/articles/showbiz/showbiznews.html?in_article_id=405303&in_page_id=1773 |title = Steve Irwin's daughter to swim with stingray that killed him |work=Daily Mail |location=UK. |date = 15 September 2006}} Steve Irwin had said he supported Bindi's career, claiming "I just want to be co-star to my daughter". {{cite news |url = http://www.news.com.au/couriermail/story/0,23739,20479123-952,00.html |title = Steve knew Bindi would be a star |publisher = Queensland Newspapers |date = 26 May 2006}} On 20 September 2006, Irwin received a standing ovation after delivering a [[eulogy]] for her father in front of a crowd of 5,000 and a worldwide television audience of more than 300 million viewers. In the 2006 ''[[TV Week]]'' readers' poll, her speech received 43 percent of votes and was voted the television moment of the year. Her mother stated that, apart from some assistance with typing, Irwin had written the speech herself. {{cite web |author = Passa, Dennis |url = http://www.forbes.com/business/manufacturing/feeds/ap/2006/09/19/ap3029795.html |title = Irwin Remembered For His 'Zest for Life". |work=Forbes magazine |date = 19 September 2006}} {{cite news |title = My daddy was my hero |publisher = News Limited |author = Chesterton, Ray |date = 20 September 2006 |url = http://www.news.com.au/dailytelegraph/story/0,22049,20448393-5009080,00.html |accessdate =26 May 2007}} {{cite news |url = http://www.smh.com.au/news/tv--radio/bindi-tops-tv-poll/2006/12/18/1166290447686.html |title = Bindi tops TV poll |work= Sydney Morning Herald |date = 18 December 2006}} In June 2007, Irwin hosted a US television special about her father called ''My Daddy the Crocodile Hunter''.{{cite news|url = http://www.news.com.au/perthnow/story/0,21598,21467635-5005382,00.html|title = Bindi Irwin to make US TV debut|date = 29 March 2007|work= The Sunday Times | first=Peta | last=Hellard}} She also starred in a child fitness DVD in which she sang and danced with a group called ''Bindi Kidfitness''. She made a [[hip hop]] album called ''Trouble in the Jungle''. 'Bindi and The Crocmen' sang "Trouble in the Jungle" on ''[[Today (U.S. TV program)|The Today Show]]'' in November 2007 and Irwin was learning how to play the piano.{{cite news|title = Terri Irwin '20/20' interview transcript excerpts|url = http://www.usatoday.com/life/2006-09-26-terri-irwin-transcript_x.htm|work=USA Today|date = 27 September 2006}}{{cite web|author = Maddison|url = http://people.aol.com/people/article/0,26334,1546416,00.html|title = Steve Irwin's Daughter Bindi Filming Own Show|work= Time|date = 16 October 2006|accessdate = 16 October 2006}} In September 2006, at age 8, Irwin appeared on the cover of the Australian magazine ''[[New Idea]]'', the youngest person to have done so in the magazine's 104-year history.{{cite news |url=http://www.smh.com.au/news/entertainment/bindi-set-for-stardom/2006/09/26/1159036536136.html | title=Bindi set for stardom | work=Sydney Morning Herald |date=26 September 2006| accessdate=28 September 2006}} [[File:Terri and Bindi Irwin.jpg|thumb]][[File:Terri and Bindi Irwin 2.jpg|thumb||Photos showing Irwin and her mother [[Terri Irwin|Terri]] at [[Edwards Air Force Base|Edwards AFB]] to film a segment for ''[[Bindi the Jungle Girl]]'' in 2007]] In early January 2007, Irwin appeared on ''[[The Ellen DeGeneres Show]]''. At that time, she was also scheduled for appearances on the ''[[Late Show with David Letterman]]'' and an attendance with [[Russell Crowe]] at a major dinner. She was promoting her new video, ''Bindi Kidfitness'', and fulfilling her role as a newly appointed "tourism ambassador" for Australia.{{cite web|url = http://www.slate.com/id/2155910/|title = Say It Ain't So, Dakota!: Paging Jodie Foster|author = Masters, Kim|date = 12 January 2007|work= Newsweek|accessdate = 18 January 2007}} Irwin appeared on ''[[Larry King Live]]'' on 11 January 2007. She said that [[creative writing]] was her favourite subject and maths her least favourite. She also said that she enjoyed being [[Homeschooling|homeschooled]] because she and her teachers were such good friends. At the ''[[2007 Kids' Choice Awards]]'', Irwin presented the award for "Favorite Male Singer", with help from [[George Lopez]] and [[Tyler James Williams]], which was won by [[Justin Timberlake]]. She also presented at the [[Logie Awards of 2007]], with help from [[Glenn Robbins]] for 'Most Outstanding Children's Show', which was won by ''[[The Upside Down Show]]''.{{cite web|title = Most Outstanding Children's Show|url = http://tvweek.ninemsn.com.au/section.aspx?sectionid=1923§ionname=logies&subsectionid=9488&subsectionname=2007nominees|accessdate = 26 May 2007 |publisher = ninemsn |archiveurl = http://web.archive.org/web/20070522213311/http://tvweek.ninemsn.com.au/section.aspx?sectionid=1923§ionname=logies&subsectionid=9488&subsectionname=2007nominees |archivedate = 22 May 2007}} On 22 November 2007, Irwin appeared with her mother Terri in the 81st Annual [[Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade]] and performed songs from her album ''Trouble in the Jungle'' with The Crocmen on a jungle animal float.{{cite web |author='Nigella' |title = 2007 Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade – Celebrity line-up|url = http://www.holidayhacks.com/2007/11/08/2007-macys-thanksgiving-day-parade-celebrity-lineup/ |date=8 November 2007 |access-date=8 October 2015}}{{cite web|title = The 81st Annual Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade Kicks Off The Holiday Season With New Iconic Balloons and Floats|url = http://emol.org/virtualmall/macys/news/2007thanksgivingdayparade.html}} On 4 May 2008, Irwin won the [[Logie Awards of 2008#Most Popular New Female Talent|Most Popular New Female Talent Logie Award]]. Then on 13 June 2008, at the age of nine, she became the youngest performer ever to win a [[Daytime Emmy Award]] when she won the award for "[[Daytime Emmy Award for Outstanding Performer in Children's Programming|Outstanding Performer in a Children's Series]]". The previous record was held by [[Camryn Grimes]], who won the "Outstanding Younger Actress in a Drama Series" at age ten for her performance in ''[[The Young and the Restless]]''. On 26 December 2009 Irwin appeared live on stage at Australia Zoo with new backup singers/dancers The Jungle Girls. Irwin commits 10% of her wage to [[Wildlife Warriors]], the charity founded by her family in 2002.{{cite news | first=Megan | last=Lehmann | coauthors= | title=Million dollar baby | date=10 July 2007 | publisher= | url =http://bulletin.ninemsn.com.au/article.aspx?id=276659 | work =The Bulletin | pages =30–35 | accessdate = 10 January 2008 }} She starred as Kirra in the movie ''[[Free Willy: Escape from Pirate's Cove]]'', released on 23 March 2010.{{cite news|title=Bindi Irwin stars in Free Willy: South Africa on DVD|work=The Daily Telegraph|last=McWhirter|first=Erin|date=10 March 2009|publisher=News Limited|url=http://www.news.com.au/dailytelegraph/story/0,22049,25166057-5006013,00.html}} In 2012, Irwin hosted a wildlife-themed game show called ''[[Bindi's Bootcamp]]''. Filmed at Australia Zoo, the contestants were put through "adventure challenges" to educate and test their wildlife knowledge.{{cite news|title=Bindi Irwin "so excited" about new television show|url=http://www.digitalspy.com/australian-tv/news/a353579/bindi-irwin-so-excited-about-new-television-show.html|first=Rebecca|last=Davies|publisher=digital spy|date=29 November 2011|accessdate=30 November 2011}} It was produced in association with Sydney-based Sticky Pictures, under commission from ABC, and debuted in July on [[ABC3]].{{cite news|title=FremantleMedia Enterprises sells Bindi's Bootcamp to Discovery Kids Asia | url=http://if.com.au/2012/08/01/article/FremantleMedia-Enterprises-sells-Bindis-Bootcamp-to-Discovery-Kids-Asia/MYOVSIRIKU.html | author=Candace Wise | date=1 August 2012 | accessdate=15 August 2012}} Irwin starred in the sequel to ''[[Nim's Island]]'' playing the lead character Nim, originally played by [[Abigail Breslin]].{{cite web|title=Production begins on Nim's Island 2 starring Bindi Irwin | url=http://mumbrella.com.au/production-begins-on-nims-island-2-starring-bindi-irwin-108440 | publisher=mUmBRELLA | date=8 August 2012 | accessdate=15 August 2012}} In 2012, Irwin appeared as Sunday Clovers on the episode "Mirror rorriM" of the [[Canada|Canadian]] television series, ''[[My Babysitter's a Vampire (TV series)|My Babysitter's a Vampire]]''. In 2013, Irwin made a brief appearance on the Australian TV series ''[[Big Brother Australia|Big Brother]]'' to surprise housemate Tim, who had mentioned her several times throughout the series, saying "I want to thank you for being an incredible Wildlife Warrior. I hope when you're out of the house you can come visit me". In March 2014, Irwin appeared on ''[[Good Morning America]]'' with her family, where she announced a partnership with animal theme park company [[Seaworld]].{{Cite news|url = http://www.theaustralian.com.au/news/nation/why-america-has-turned-on-bindi-irwin-over-seaworld-endorsement/story-e6frg6nf-1226847750778|title = Why America has turned on Bindi Irwin over SeaWorld endorsement|last = |first = |date = 7 March 2015|work = [[The Australian]]|access-date = 19 October 2015|via = }} This decision was strongly criticized by animal rights group [[PETA]], who criticized the Irwin family for supporting a company accused of animal abuse, referencing the documentary ''[[Blackfish (film)|Blackfish]]''.{{cite web|url=http://www.peta.org/media/news-releases/petas-statement-re-bindi-irwin-becomes-seaworlds-latest-shill/|title=PETA's statement, re: Bindi Irwin becomes SeaWorld's latest shill|publisher=PETA |date=6 March 2014 |accessdate=8 October 2015}} In October 2014, Irwin was awarded Young Conservationist of the Year by the [[Australian Geographic Society]].{{cite web|title=Winners of the 2014 AG Society Awards|url=http://www.australiangeographic.com.au/society/awards/2014/10/australian-geographic-society-awards-2014-winners|publisher=Australian Geographic Society|accessdate=6 October 2015|date=28 October 2014}} In August 2015, Irwin was announced as a competitor on ''[[Dancing with the Stars (U.S. TV series)|Dancing with the Stars]]'' – [[Dancing with the Stars (U.S. season 21)|season 21]],{{cite web|url=http://abcnews.go.com/Entertainment/dancing-stars-season-21-bindi-irwin-revealed-celebrity/story?id=33236211|title=Bindi Irwin to Compete on 'Dancing With the Stars'|work=ABC News|date=24 August 2015|accessdate=24 August 2015}} paired with five-time champion [[Derek Hough]].{{cite web|url=http://www.eonline.com/news/691981/dancing-with-the-stars-s-season-21-full-cast-revealed-find-out-the-celebs-and-their-pro-partners/cast-announcement|title=Dancing With the Stars' Season 21 Full Cast Revealed: Find Out the Celebs and Their Pro Partners!|work=[[E!|E! Online]] |date=2 September 2015 }} Since Irwin was a minor during the competition, she required special permission by California courts to perform. Irwin and Hough were declared the winners of the season on 24 November 2015. ==Filmography== ===Television=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Year ! Title ! Role ! class="unsortable" | Notes |- | 2007–08 | ''[[Bindi the Jungle Girl]]'' | Herself | |- | 2012 | ''[[My Babysitter's a Vampire (TV series)|My Babysitter's a Vampire]]'' | Sunday Clovers | Episode: "Mirror, rorriM" |- | 2012 | ''[[Bindi's Bootcamp]]'' | Host | Gameshow |- | 2012 | ''Steve Irwin's Wildlife Warriors'' | Herself | |- | 2012 |''[[Curious George (TV series)|Curious George]]'' | Bindi Bungee (Voice) | Episode: "Monkey Down Under/Bright Lights, Little Monkey" (7.1) |- | 2015 | ''[[Dancing with the Stars (U.S. TV series)|Dancing with the Stars]]'' | Herself / Contestant | [[Dancing with the Stars (U.S. season 21)|Season 21]] winner |} ===Film=== {| class="wikitable" |- ! Year ! Title ! Role ! Notes |- | 2010 | ''[[Free Willy: Escape from Pirate's Cove]]'' | Kirra Cooper | |- | 2013 | ''[[Return to Nim's Island]]'' | Nim Rusoe | |} ===Internet=== {| class="wikitable" |- ! Year ! Title ! Role ! Notes |- | 2012 | ''[[Growing Up Wild]]'' | Herself | With her young brother Robert they show their wildest animals at [[Australia Zoo]] on The Pet Collective, a popular animal focused [[YouTube]] channel. |} ==''Dancing with the Stars'' performances== Irwin, who was partnered with [[Derek Hough]], won [[Dancing with the Stars (U.S. season 21)|season 21]] of ''[[Dancing with the Stars (U.S. TV series)|Dancing with the Stars]]'' (U.S.) on 24 November 2015. Irwin and Hough hold the record for the most [[Dancing with the Stars (U.S. TV series)#Number of perfect scores|perfect scores]], with eight. {|class="wikitable" border="1" style="float:left;" |- !rowspan="2" style="background:#CCCCCC;" |Week # !rowspan="2" style="background:#CCCCCC;" |Dance / Song !colspan="3" style="background:#CCCCCC;" |Judges' scores !rowspan="2" style="background:#CCCCCC;" |Result |- !style="background:#CCCCCC;" width="10%" |Inaba !style="background:#CCCCCC;" width="10%" |Hough !style="background:#CCCCCC;" width="10%" |Tonioli |- style="text-align: center; background:#faf6f6;" |1 |[[Jive (dance)|Jive]] / "[[Crocodile Rock]]" |8 |8 |8 |No elimination |- style="text-align: center; background:#faf6f6;" |2 |[[Ballroom tango|Tango]] / "[[You Shook Me All Night Long]]"

Hough performed with [[Alexa PenaVega]]. 3 Score given by guest judge [[Maksim Chmerkovskiy]]. 4 Score given by guest judge [[Olivia Newton-John]]. ==References== {{Reflist|2}} ==External links== {{Commons category|Bindi Irwin}} * [http://animal.discovery.com/tv/planets-best/terri-bindi/terri-bindi.html Story of Steve and Terri] at [[Animal Planet]] * [http://www.crocodilehunter.com.au/crocodile_hunter/about_steve_terri/bindi_biography.html Bindi Irwin] at Australia Zoo * {{IMDb name|id=1134702|name=Bindi Irwin}} {{S-start}} {{s-ach}} {{succession box | title=[[Dancing with the Stars (US TV series)|''Dancing with the Stars'' (US)]] winners | before=[[Rumer Willis]] & [[Valentin Chmerkovskiy]]| years=Season 21
(Fall 2015 with [[Derek Hough]])|after=[[Nyle DiMarco]] & [[Peta Murgatroyd]]}} {{S-end}} {{Dancing with the Stars (United States)}} {{Steve Irwin}} {{Authority control}} {{Use dmy dates|date=March 2016}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Irwin, Bindi Sue}} [[Category:1998 births]] [[Category:21st-century Australian actresses]] [[Category:Australian child actresses]] [[Category:Australian people of American descent]] [[Category:Australian people of English descent]] [[Category:Australian people of Irish descent]] [[Category:Australian television presenters]] [[Category:Daytime Emmy Award winners]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Participants in American reality television series]] [[Category:People from Nambour, Queensland]] [[Category:People from the Sunshine Coast, Queensland]] [[Category:Dancing with the Stars (U.S. TV series) winners]] [[Category:Irwin family]]
